alert.note: Alert for Henry; Mercer; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:43AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of southwestern Rock Island, Mercer, western Henry, Cedar, northeastern Benton, southwestern Delaware, Muscatine, Linn, Buchanan, western Scott, northeastern Johnson, Jones and southwestern Clinton Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 441 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairbank to near Seaton. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, lightning and additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Muscatine, Independence, Anamosa, Manchester, Aledo, Tipton, West Branch, Durant, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Marion, Hiawatha, Milan, Mount Vernon, Monticello and West Liberty. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 254 and 292. Interstate 380 between mile markers 19 and 55. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
